column1: Lakinsk (Russian: Ла́кинск) is a town in Sobinsky District of Vladimir Oblast
column3: located on the left bank of the Klyazma River
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 15

column1: It grew out of the village of Undol (Ундол)
column2: which was in the same area as the modern town and has been documented since at least the end of the 15th century. In 1889
column3: a spinning-and-weaving factory was opened near the village. As the factory developed
column5: Undol was granted work settlement status and renamed Lakinsky (Лакинский) after the local party leader. It was granted town status and renamed Lakinsk in 1969.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Lakinsk is directly subordinated to Sobinsky District. As a municipal division
column3: the town of Lakinsk is incorporated within Sobinsky Municipal District as Lakinsk Urban Settlement.
